page.title: 16RAF BRIZE NORTON BEGINNINGS
page.content: The airforce came to {Brize Norton} in 1937 bringing the outside world to a very quiet backwater of West Oxfordshire.During the {Second World {War}it became the home of the {Heavy {Glider Planes}used in the invasion of {Europe}and at{Arnhem.}In 1950 the station was loaned to the U.S. and was used as a base for U.S.A.F. bombers. They extended the runway and cut off {Black Bourton}from{Carterton}and even Carterton from its railway station.The RAF returned in 1965 and since then the base has been the centre of the RAF's world wide{transport fleet}. In the 1980's the{VC_10's}travel regularly to Hong Kong,Cyprus & Germany eastwards & the U.S.A. and Canada westwards. Two{Tristars}now shuttle between Brize Norton and the South Atlantic to maintain the garrison in the Falklands.
